articles.content:
A record number of people started new businesses in the US last year, ushering in a new class of entrepreneurs.

articles.title: $13 a month for heat and electricity. A tale of two solar converts - Lewiston Sun Journal
articles.description: The downside: the initial investment. But these solar supporters say the cost is about what they were paying for heat and electricity monthly before solar, and in eight to 12 years, they'll be on Easy Street.
articles.content: Rick Chase stands in front of solar panels he had installed on his roof in South Paris in November. Chase says hes paying about the same amount for the investment in the panels as he used to pay for … [+5996 chars]
